message: This is a high-quality product. It's worth $100 to me, but I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm not trying to deceive you, and I'm confident you'll be happy with your purchase. What do you say?
Thank you for your honesty and confidence in the product. I trust your assessment and am willing to make the purchase.

I'm glad you're happy with the first purchase! I want to assure you that this product is also of the highest quality. However, I've been thinking, and I'm willing to give you a slight discount on this one. I'll sell it to you for $90. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
I appreciate the discount and your confidence in the product. Given the value it holds for me, I'm willing to accept the offer and make the purchase.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchases! However, I want to be upfront with you about this next product. I've been having some quality control issues lately, and I'm not entirely confident about the quality of this one. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I'm also offering a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund.
Given the uncertainty around the product's quality and the lack of a quality assurance track record, I would prefer to pass on this opportunity and avoid potential dissatisfaction.

I completely understand your caution last time, and I appreciate your decision to wait for a more confident opportunity.
